(last updated 2003-03-31)

Name : Keiichi Shinoda

Email : shino-k&post.yamaha.co.jp

MIME media type name : Application

MIME subtype name : Vendor Tree - vnd.yamaha.hv-dic

Required parameters : none

Optional parameters : none

Encoding considerations : binary
This media type may require encoding on transports not capable of handling
binary.

Security considerations :
The content doesn't contain executable code and hence cannot be employed
maliciously.

Interoperability considerations : none

Published specification :
HV Voice Dictionary is a data format specification intended mainly to define
a data format for humanoid voice based multimedia content, transporatble via
internet/intranet/wireless internet in very small packages.
HV Voice Dictionary specification data is expressed as voice dictionary data
for each output device.
The format enables and specifies keynote data to start playing back like
humanoid voice ,and as a result, HV Voice Dictionary will be playing like
humanoid voice.

Applications which use this media :
Embeded HV Voice Dictionary player on cellular phone,personal digital
assistant or other electronic equipments.
  HV Voice Dictionary Authoring tool on PC.
  HV Voice Dictionary player Application on PC.

Additional information :

1. Magic number(s) : none
2. File extension(s) : .hvd
3. Macintosh file type code : none
4. Object Identifiers: none

Person to contact for further information :

1. Name : Tomohiro Yamamoto
2. Email : tyamamoto&asc.yamaha.co.jp

Intended usage : Common

Author/Change controller :  Keiichi Shinoda or Tomohiro Yamamoto
 Yamaha Corporation
 203 Matsunokijima Toyooka-mura Iwata-gun
 Shizuoka-ken 438-0192 Japan

(file created 2003-03-31)
